title: Can you give me 8 reasons why you think the scariest movie you've ever seen is the scariest movie you've ever seen? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s been quite some time, but the scariest movie I’ve ever seen was “The Blair Witch Project”. I’m not sure if I can come up with eight reasons, but I will do my best to list those I do have: This movie arrived at a time when the internet was just beginning to be widely adopted.The marketing campaign (brilliantly) incorporated a website that perpetuated the movie’s plot as if it had actually happened, so many (myself included) initially thought these were real life events.I remember sitting alone in my home office watching the many “interviews” on said site that were quite unnerving.This movie was the epitome of what’s called the “found footage” style, but the film makers took that to another level - incorporating the “found” aspect into the plot, as in this footage was “found” after its creators disappeared.The TV ads for this movie are the first that I recall showing audience members jumping in real fear. Although I’m sure it’s been used before, this seemed like a fresh approach at the time.The actors were all unknowns who, for all anyone knew at the time, were indeed college documentarians. Their performances were natural and convincing enough to fool thousands of unsuspecting movie goers (myself included).I wanted to see this movie more than anyone in my immediate cirle, so I ended up going to the theater alone to watch it. The theater was virtually empty, as I had a flexible schedule and could go at off peak times.This is the first movie that kept me up for several days afterwards, visions of shaky cam horrors dancing though my head.Hope that answers your question to your satisfaction.
